I don't know for sure because PSN banned my account without telling me a reason why, then when I asked why, they bricked my ps4. It's been since September 2022, still no answer, and they dance around the subject when I call in.  If you buy these,  don't use the online features of your Playstation for anything but playing the game, anything else has a high chance of getting you banned for literally nothing. avaliacoes: I ordered the PS5 God of War Ragnarok bundle, but received the PS5 Horizon Forbidden West bundle instead. Naturally, I did not want to return the whole system and try again so I contacted Amazon customer service.  It was definitely a hassle to connect with a real person through chat as the customer service on order issues does not allow for much flexibility of issues and the initial chats were useless AI, but I did eventually connect with someone who was able to give me a partial refund so that I could but the correct game. As for the system, it was easy to set-up and it works terrific, but the games take forever to download. I am used to plugging in a system, inserting a disk and playing within minutes. The game I downloaded for this system took about an hour. Even a game I bought on disk took several minutes to download before I could play.  It's a minor inconvenience in the grand scheme of things, but kind of frustrating when you are excited to tear open a box and start playing with the new toy.

avaliacoes: After waiting almost 2 years to the day, I finally got a PS5 in November last year (2022), and it was certainly worth the long and excruciating wait. I would have been happy with just the system but what was available to me first was this God of War bundle and while it cost more, it turned out to make sense because I planned to get this game anyway, and getting the bundle afforded me the game for $10 less. I only have positives for this purchase, as it is amazing! My sole disappointment concerning this bundle was that I was expecting the game to be in disc form with the case in the box but I was surprised that it was just a card with a code for the digital game. I like to showcase my game cases to show which games I have and I was expecting a disc game with the case but all in all, I still have a superb console and a $70 game for $10 less. Recommended!

produto: PlayStation PS5 Console ‚Äì God of War Ragnar√∂k Bundle
avaliacoes: As an almost 50 year old who is not a huge gamer and has been waiting forever to finally upgrade, I'm glad that I finally did. I wasn't sure if this was going to be a good decision or not, but really it's been better than expected! First, it's almost paid off due to Christmas money. Second, I was concerned about the cost of building a collection of games. But due to the fact that there's so many games and so many sales, especially on the games I like, I have a small collection of fun games already in many different genres that feels well rounded, and didn't cost a fortune to get! I'm slowly reacquiring my favorite games like the God of War franchise and the Arkham Batman games, while discovering old arcade games that are super cheap, as well as newer games like Spiderman Miles Morales, Spiderman, Ghostbusters, Creed boxing, and Stray all on sale. It's a great time to be gaming, and while I generally am not a big gamer, I went through a phase where I was gaming a lot just before meeting my wife Rebecca, and then life got busy, crazy, and wild for a good long time. But now I have a little bit more stability, and while still busy as heck, I have a couple of hours here and there to enjoy. I even bought Trivial Pursuit just to get Rebecca into the fold. She doesn't really even know how to use the dualsense controller! So I'm trying to get her involved enough to learn how to use the controller and navigate around in different ways. Anyway, very pleased with the purchase! I've played a little bit and it's a great experience. Quite a step up from the PS3, and a good time to get back into the gaming world. I'm glad that the shortage is ending, and I'm glad I did this when I did. Had I bought it in 2020 it probably would have been a weirder experience. I feel like gaming is finally at a place where oldsters, youngsters, and middle of the roadsters like myself can find something to enjoy.

produto: PlayStation PS5 Console ‚Äì God of War Ragnar√∂k Bundle
avaliacoes: So after 2 years, I've finally gotten a PS5.  It is everything I expected and nothing less.  Granted I didn't have too many expectations.  Graphics are definitely a step up from the PS4. Faster load times for sure. Controllers are comfortable and familiar with a few added features such as vibrating triggers and a built in microphone.  Some not so great things about it could be led by the ridiculously expensive cost to add on to this already expensive machine.  Standard controllers start at 79usd before sales and discounts.  The built in memory storage is pretty lame and it costs upwards from 100usd and beyond to upgrade to any quality internal ssd.  Lots of good options out there for that though so pick and choose as you'd like.  Don't even get me started on the PSVR2 price tag!! If that's your thing.  I mean overall, the PS5 is next gen and it is fun, but at what cost.  However, at this point in the PS5's existence, I don't feel like my PS4 is obsolete yet. Mostly everything that the PS5 has, is just a tad better than what the PS4 offers.  If you're on the fence about the next gen systems but not suffering from FOMO(fear of missing out) then go ahead and wait a little longer.  Nothing super extraordinary about the PS5 yet.  But if you have the means to spend on it, then go ahead, you won't be disappointed, just don't expect this thing to be revolutionary as of now.

avaliacoes: So I currently have a custom pc with a 3080ti, xbox series x, and now a ps5. My son has a Nintendo switch. From someone who's tried them all the pc is the best... however when it comes to console the playstation is far superior in gaming and experience. Ever since the first start up to all the exclusive titles this console is unparalleled. I haven't touched my Xbox In a looong time. Today I'm experiencing all the playstation only things and can tell I'll be finding myself coming back for more the Xbox lacks that for me right now. The pc will always be homebound but this console is amazing... the duel sense controller feels soo good and adds a WHOLE new level of immersion to gaming it really makes and sounds like you're in the game. Only downfall is lack of Bluetooth support. Luckily my OLED display has Bluetooth capability so I can use my Sony xm4 earbuds.

avaliacoes: I love this thing. I bought the disc version and would recommend that to everyone else. You get the best of both worlds with disc version.  You can buy physical games that come in a bundle package that have rare ps5 related items! Also if you buy digital games they have amazing deals on the PS store! Look around for the cheapest deal on games, it will save you a ton of money. I would recommend buying an additional memory booster. Some of these digital games are well over 100gbs! You will only have around 600gbs when you start off with a new ps5 I believe. Memory gets used up extremely fast! I also had a pleasant experience buying this from here. From me sending a request to purchase a ps5, I had an email invite like 2 days later plus only like 2 days to send it. So I received it extremely fast! I have heard of people waiting much longer though. This can also play most ps4 games as well. Also you can get a playstation plus membership for like $15 a month that allows you to play tons of ps5 and ps4 games. There is a lot of cool things to do with this ps5!! Highly recommend!!

About the code (and this applies to any console bundled with a digital game): THE CODE WILL ONLY WORK ON A UNITED STATES PLAYSTATION ACCOUNT. The code can only be redeemed for an account which has an address in the US. You can NOT change your accoun's region/address after creating it, so it is important to either have the account already in the US or have a second account with a US address.

This was a pure impulse buy. I submitted a request to buy this as a gift for my family at Christmas. No one in my family are avid gamers, with the exception of my oldest daughter, so I thought it would be mostly a once in a while unit they could use while visiting. I have always had a mild interest in gaming but became a big fan after playing the PC version of the Fellowship of the Ring.  Imagine my dismay to learn that this console will not play any physical disks of games pre-PS4. It plays digital versions of older games, but it won‚Äôt read physical disks. What is the point of having a disk option then?  By now these consoles should be able to read all past physical disks. I think it petty of PlayStation not to allow their customers the option to play older games. What gives?  We paid a lot of money for this console to be limited this way. Unless PS changes this, I‚Äôm only playing digital games on sale. No subscriptions for me because we just don‚Äôt play enough to warrant a $17.99 /month subscription.

While I'm not opposed to the existence of PS5, I firmly believe that gamers like myself have not been taken into account. You see, in my 54 years I've seen the entire history of home video game consoles. My collection begins with an Atari 2600. I have various Nintendo, Sega, PlayStation and Xbox models. I've spent thousands of dollars on games which I can no longer play. The consoles work but they are incompatible with modern "televisions" without serious modification. I also distrust downloading stuff online - I prefer a hardcopy of a game on disk. Even if I wanted a PS5, I discover that you have to be INVITED to be able to purchase one. This makes it doubly upsetting since there are games in the works which will be PS5 only (such as Final Fantasy VII: Rebirth). I was looking forward to playing these games. Also, I've never had a problem with my PS4 and I think the processing speed and graphics are perfectly fine. I may be in a minority but why must I be forced request an invitation to spend $500 I don't want to spend on a console I otherwise don't need? Unlike other consumers, I can live without these games - after all that's just what they are - games; a luxury, not a necessity. Sure I want to see how Horizon develops and how the remake of Final Fantasy VII turns out. I was looking forward to seeing Cosmo Canyon and the Golden Saucer fully realized with modern technology. But the simple fact is that I can live without it. Sorry  Sony. You just lost a very loyal customer.

I received a defective PS5 console (randomly turns to black and sometimes green screen), have initiated a return, and I am unable to reorder because of the following: "To meet high demand for this item, we limit purchases to one per customer." Within less than a week of receiving the PS5, it began to unexpectedly turn to a black screen (and sometimes green!) either when turning on the system or in the middle of playing a game. I contacted Playstation customer service, did all of their recommended troubleshoots including purchasing a brand new HDMI cable (even though this was supposed to be a brand new product), trying it on another television, etc, etc, but to no avail. I would prefer to simply have it replaced and I don't think that is too much to ask given what I received was defective and no fault of my own, however, the only option available is to return for a refund and re-order. While I was told by amazon customer service that re-ordering would not be an issue, that has unfortunately not been the case given that now it is not allowing me to place this re-order because "To meet high demand for this item, we limit purchases to one per customer." So I am now stuck having wasted a great deal of time, money (purchased brand new hdmi cable, new packaging for return, etc), and time for a defective product that I am not even able to replace. Lastly, it appears that other folks have reported similar issues around the same time (november/december 2022) so perhaps this latest batch of consoles that amazon is selling share in this defect.

The lauded and scarce PS5 console finally arrived for this humble reviewer after winning a chance to buy via Amazon (the third entry, the second win). The machine is enormous, as other have no doubt noted, dwarfing its predecessor to the point of near absurdity. Thankfully, apart from a familiar whir when starting up, it is whisper quiet. Once a game or film is loaded, there are virtually no load times. The interfaces are easy to use and downloads are quick from the Playstation Store. If you have a mounted TV, beware that the HDMI cable provided is woefully short and despite its towering height, you'll probably need to prop your console up on something in order to reach to intended input port. Be sure to affix to the stand first as the beast does tend to be top-heavy. If you're like me, you'll tire quickly of the loud, sometimes obnoxious sounds emanating from the controller during play. The haptic feedback is a nice touch, though. The graphical improvements over the PS4 are the true stars of the show, however. Do yourself a favor and download Demons' Souls, even, or especially, if the lack of graphical polish in prior From Software games has depressed you. Flip the game to Vivid mode and prepare to be wowed by the  the cleanness, the shimmer, the smoothness. Indeed, from top to bottom (and what a journey that is geographically across the console!), the PS5 is very, very smooth.

Let‚Äôs give Sony a round of applause for lying and saying the system just naturally gets 120 fps and all this other stuff because it doesn‚Äôt.. UNLESS you spend $400 more on a NEW model monitor with hdmi 2.1. I have a 240hz Alienware monitor that was $600 and all because it doesn‚Äôt have hdmi 2.1 you can‚Äôt get 120 fps. Same old 60 fps, absolutely no different than the PS4 in any way If you play on a monitor made before 2020 or play on a TV. Applause to the person who‚Äôs idea it was to not put a display port slot on the PS5, what an absolute award winning genius. On top of them reeling you in with the lies about the frames, the internet has MAJOR trouble connecting to the PS5 for whatever reason. I use a LAN cable and 200 mbps internet, and it works amazing and perfect with every single other device and all of my lan cables work the same too.. EXCEPT for the PS5. When I turn it on, it doesn‚Äôt even read the LAN cable for over a half an hour and I have to restart the ps5 around 10 times or more before it finally reads the LAN cable and I can play. This isn‚Äôt a problem for only me. Read the Reddit forums on the PS5 and it‚Äôs a major issue. This system was made with absolutely no effort whatsoever, has almost no exclusive games made for it so you‚Äôre pretty much only playing PS4 games, and for its price on top of having to get a monitor or TV that‚Äôs so new it has all the updated connectivity slots, you‚Äôre looking at $900+ to play this system to its potential. Save yourself time, money, and effort and get a PC that will give you no issues and will last longer. I‚Äôm getting rid of my PS5 here soon. Worst PlayStation system I have ever touched in my entire time of being alive. I have never regretted buying a system in my life until I got the PS5. Do. Not. Buy.

Recommend the Disc version as the physical copies have a lot more sales then Digital store feont.  Sony doesn't allow third party retailers to sell redeemable codes for their storefront either, Nintendo & Microsoft do allow this.  A lot of Sony First Party titles are now on Steam as well and run great even on a Steam Deck which just received FSR 2.1 and manages to run even CyberPunk 2077 grear.  PS5 Dual Sense even receiving better drivers on PC now taking advantage of the Dual Sense triggers.  For PS1/PS2/PS3 Libraries you're much better off in DEV mode with an XBox Series S|X for $20.00.

So this console looks fantastic. A great recreation of the original playstation console in a small portable form factor. The controllers are still nice even to today's standards, though wish they had analog sticks. The games on system are a bit lackluster and a mixed bag as some games are PAL versions so they run a tad slow but some decent games. In its stock state it's quite mediocre.  Where this console really shines is though the mod scene. You can add retroarch and emulation station interface, add more games, or replace games on the internal storage with better options to make its stock state more likeable!! There's even an option to overclock it and make ganes look even better, giving you more value for this product. You can even add Wi-Fi and Bluetooth controllers if you want. I'd give a modded PS classic a 5, but I'm going to say 3 stars for the stock state which is lacking, but it's a great novel concept and has great aesthetic, taking up little room as well!

The PS Classic is well built, controllers have decent length but bit on the short side so you'll need extension cables. So overall build is excellent. However the biggest issue is the roster of games. You get 20 games in this mini console, most of the games included don't make any sense and I was left wondering why they included some of these games over other titles. The PS Classic is missing big name titles like Resident Evil 2, Crash Bandicoot, Sypro, Castlevania and many more. Yes, you can hack it to include more games but obviously the average consumer may not want to go through the trouble. I only recommend this to die hard Sony fans or gaming collectors.

avaliacoes: My son wanted to play old games. Specifically final fantasy 7. After ordering an old disk online and watching online videos of how to reset my old playstation 2 laser gear i finally found this solution. It is a little more than the used disks online but worth it as we have found that we play one of the fighting games, tekken, a lot. That alone is worth the cost and has been a blast. We usually play it in the past at a vintage  arcade. This also made my son realize we could do this on raspberry pi. One negative thing is the cord for the controller is short. A solution was to get a long hdmi cable.

avaliacoes: What an awesome little system! Thus far it works as expected--all of the games are operational. It is a little disappointinog that it only comes with 20 games and none of them are "Silent Hill" (missed opportunity, Sony). This does not come with an AC power adapter, but I just used the one that came with my phone--works wonderfully! All the cords fit into the system securely and it powers on and off properly. Al external buttons are operational. I bought this unit "new" from "Cotree" but the language was was not set to the default and there were saves on it from whomever owned it previously, so I suggest buying it from another seller.

An ACTUAL review of the ACTUAL product!

I see many of these reviews are just by people who don't own one & are upset they don't have the determination to get one. So here's an actual review by me, who actually was determined enough to get one. No, I didn't buy it from a scalper, I paid retail (for those who are going to accuse me of it). So, there's not many games for this. Period. It sucks & I would have thought there would have been more by launch but I was letdown in that aspect. Nevertheless, it is what it is. So, the controller is amazing & it's very comfortable. The mic is meh, according to my friends, so it's better to use a headset or wired mic. I play COD: CW for hours & my hands are never worn out. As far as durability goes I'm not sure yet as I haven't thrown it across the room in anger so far....but it's going to happen at some point. The lil stand the PS5 sits on it dope, works well as you can see in the pic. Now, the PS5 system itself, that's a little less great so far & here's why: stability. Maybe it's just COD: CW (b/c that's the only PS5 game I have) but it caused my system to crash repeatedly, multiple times a day. The PS5 even crashed coming out of rest mode. I had to literally download the PS5 SW from Sony & completely wipe my PS5 & reinstall to (hopefully) fix the issue. This was last week & no crashing yet so I hope it's fixed. The GUI takes some time to get used to, I have no idea how to easily logoff anymore as when I hold the PS5 button it does nothing, so I have to go to my pic @ the top right & choose logoff then hit the PS5 button just to click 'enter rest mode.' There might be an easier way but I haven't cared enough to Google it, but for now this is only slightly annoying. I don't like that I can't have all my games added into a folder on the main tab, it's annoying. Instead I have to go to the 'Games' tab & cycle through games installed just to find the one I want to play. #MakeFoldersForGamesAnOptionAgain . Besides these quirks, I think it's pretty decent. I did find that COD: CW runs better using performance mode vs resolution mode (I think that's what it's called) & you have to change that in the PS5 system settings. Also, it's pretty heavy (10lbs I read) & tall (when standing up) & it won't fit in the table in the pic on its side so I need to get an actual entertainment center now. If you can get one easily though for retail, I say go for it but don't pay outrageous prices. If you're not able to get one, just wait b/c there's not a lot of games for it anyway.

Digital only is a no go.

For $100 you lose the disc drive. It's just not worth it even if you do mostly digital gaming. The ability to get games at the best price from ANY retailer over a 7 year period just isn't worth the $100 difference (case in point, Amazon just had a buy 2 get 1 free sale and I got cod:nice, godfall and ac:valhalla two days after launch and saved $70. That's almost the coast difference right there. Plus, I'll probably trade in cod:bocw to GameStop in a couple weeks and get $35 back of that money (I really only play single player generally). So I've saved $70 plus $35 and look at that, I've paid for my disc drive and that's within a couple weeks of launch. Not to mention the ability to play 4k movies uncompressed rather than over streaming off disc, play an occasional dvd or blu ray or pick up old ps4 games for $5-10 to try.  I could go on and on (like the fact you never truly "own" a digital game, internet data caps ((1TB here)), etc.) The system overall is great, but these digital editions are just a joke. It's to no one's benefit except Sony (& Microsoft) even if you are a mostly digital gamer, why give a corporation full control over where you can buy a game. Competition is one of the most important factors that gives us sale prices. If only one company can sell something, they set the price and their profit margin. Don't give that power as a consumer away.

avaliacoes: Pardon for my late review. I recieve my ps4 pro about a week ago from my courier and everything is perfect so far except for it seems like something is wrong with my controller. If I'm in a menu or something, even just playing a game my cursor just keep scrolling up as if I'm pushing up on the analog stick. This happen only sometime and can be annoying if I'm playing a gun game that require aiming, my character would just constantly be looking up even when I'm trying to center the view to get an accurate aim. I doubt this is the console and more to be the controller issue. Otherwise I'm loving my upgrade from the base ps4 to the pro. The only reason this ain't a 5 star is because of my control. Now I guess I'm gonna have to buy one.

avaliacoes: I bought a second hand PS4 from this company. It was described as being in Like New condition. It arrived soon enough, and everything seemed okay. Everything was in the box, and it looked okay. I then plugged everything in and tried to turn it on, and nothing happened! I used to own the same type of PS4 years ago, so I know what is supposed to happen. The console they sent me does not work. I am furious and I am going to do what I can to get a refund, but, I'm not optimistic about that happening. The first thing I have decided to do is leave this review. People deserve to know that something like this might happen. Do not buy from this company! I spent hundreds of pounds on equipment that does not work, and I don't want that to happen to anyone else.

It's been since September 2022, still no answer, and they dance around the subject when I call in. These cards work to purchase items from the PSN store. THIS MEANS YOU DO NOT OWN THE GAME, JUST THE RIGHT TO PLAY IT. If you get your account banned for any reason, everything you purchased is gone.  This wouldn't bother me, but,  PSN actively spies on your personal messages and conversations to FIND THINGS to ban you for. I've had a psn account since 2010, I talked to friends online about various things, some of which are trials active at the time, I think discussing this with my friend got me banned.  I don't know for sure because PSN banned my account without telling me a reason why, then when I asked why, they bricked my ps4. It's been since September 2022, still no answer, and they dance around the subject when I call in.  If you buy these,  don't use the online features of your Playstation for anything but playing the game, anything else has a high chance of getting you banned for literally nothing. produto: PlayStation DualSense Wireless Controller - Starlight Blue - PlayStation 5
avaliacoes: I absolutely love this controller. This is by far the best PS5 controller I‚Äôve ever owned . It‚Äôs very simple to change the modules and sticks. Just the push of a switch pops the cover off. Also configuring the button mapping and stick sensitivity is easy . Creating your own profile for different games is effortless. It feels sturdy, just all around well made. The battery life isn‚Äôt the greatest but I usually keep it plugged in anyway. The locking mechanism for the usb cable is also nice. Which I believe will greatly extend the life of the wire. Everything else about the controller is just great in my opinion. If you‚Äôre a hardcore gamer I really think it is well worth 200 dollars. I have spent more money on other custom aftermarket controllers, yet the Edge is so much better.

avaliacoes: When I got this controller it was impressive.  Superior fit and finish and the force feedback was several steps above the previous generation.  Unfortunately after less than a year of light use, the right joystick is fatally broken.  When sitting perfectly still on my desk, the input jitters between center and full left.  No amount of dead zones can fix it, it is full 100% left.  I have Dual Shock 2 controllers from when I was a heavy gamer that still work, but this expensive thing is broken after 8 months of mostly not even using the joystick.

Yeah I have a my cable from the original dual sense and that works fine, but what if I lost my cable and was purchasing this in hopes to get a new one? This means you have to by a cable separately. Such a money grab like 75 buck is enough. Sony starting to feel like greedy apple.

avaliacoes: Nice looking controller but the battery only lasts for a few hours. Having used the xbox elite 2 controller with 30+ hours of use this DualSense Edge controller is utter trash. and only having a single paddle on the back instead of two really sucks because you'd expect them to at least try to match the competition somewhere but they failed in every aspect. When the competition has better customizing and longer battery life (as well as every aftermarket controller for the PS5) you know you've failed. Save your money and get the Victrix or the Razer PS5 controller. Both of them are better than this PS created garbage. It doesn't even have wireless charging with its case (as the Xbox elite controller does) yet another annoying part. The biggest pro is that it comes with a charge cord that's super long, because they knew the battery was trash, so you can at least use it as a corded controller when the battery dies (which I'm sure is exactly what people are paying for when they buy this, a corded "pro" controller [sarcasm])

avaliacoes: I was not really a PlayStation fan until the PS5, but I love this controller, the haptics are great, and it has rechargeable batteries, a touchpad and gyro. Not just great for console, but also my preferred controller for PC games. The only problem with that is that some games don‚Äôt natively support it, and you may need to install DS4 windows to use it for everything. The touchpad and gyro really make up for that, as you can use them to do something like move the mouse and operate some interfaces with just the controller. If you are looking for a PlayStation controller, you don‚Äôt have a ton of options, but if you have a choice in which controller to use like on PC, this is far better than the XBox and Switch controllers at the same price point

avaliacoes: I having owned or even used a PlayStation system since the PS2 so I was looking forward to getting back into that ecosystem. I love the innovation in these Dual Sense PS5 controllers and it actually feels great in hand but I still prefer the Xbox controller layout and feel. Plus, there is no faster option to recharge batteries than to swap in fresh ones, preferably rechargeable batteries. When the Dual Sense batteries are worn out, it's over and these controllers are about $70US today, in 2023 so just imagine the price in a few years cause you're going to get at least a few years out of them. By the way, battery life is already kinda lean. But the controllers absolutely are different and "next gen" even if the features are a bit gimmicky, I'll take that kinda of innovation/ gimmick for the price of these especially after being away from PlayStation for over a decade.

So the retailer is selling older models of the controller that, if needed, cannot be warranty serviced by Sony.

avaliacoes: These controllers develop stick drift in a matter of months. The 2 I got with the console each got stick drift within 3 months. Sony replaced them and both of the replacements got stick drift after just over a year. So that is a total of 4 Dualsense controllers that got stick drift. My PS4 controllers went many years with no issues, but these Dualsense controllers are not reliable. It is unfortunate because the controller has a good feel to it, but replacing annually is a deal breaker.

produto: PlayStation DualSense Wireless Controller - Starlight Blue - PlayStation 5
avaliacoes: The controller is one of the most comfortable I have ever had the pleasure of holding. The compliments stop there. It has a few new features the Dualshock 4 lacks, but otherwise has the same performance specs, right down to the absolutely terrible battery life. Have to always keep it plugged in because it only last 4 hours (if even that), whereas every other controller I have lasts 20 hours or more. The material it is made out of makes it a grease magnet, so expect your hands to slip if they start to sweat. The face buttons are nice, but the dpad is rough on the hands if you play games that use it a lot, like fighting games. Not to mention that the share button is in a terrible spot that makes it all to easy to press accidentally. Biggest gripe of all though, is the stick drift. Sony invested 0 dollars into improving the joysticks quality and put an abysmal warranty period on it purely because they make more money not doing so. The only saving grace is it being nice to hold.

avaliacoes: I used to own an xbox core controller but L2 and R2 buttons are too convexed for me that resting my middle fingers on them felt straining. That is my main reason for switching back to a PS controller. I've had a PS4 controller and I really loved how relatively flatter the L2/R2 buttons. Upgrading to the PS5 controller, I can say that it really feels more premium to hold. However, the buttons are a bit stiffer to actuate. I actually missed the softness of buttons from the xbox controller. The joysticks felt more fluid to use in the xbox controller, in my experience, but I love symmetry that is why I did not get used to the asymmetric form of the xbox controller. All in all, I am happy with the PS5 controller.

produto: PlayStation DualSense Wireless Controller - Starlight Blue - PlayStation 5
avaliacoes: The PlayStation DualSense Wireless Controller in Midnight Black is a top-notch choice for any gamer. The haptic feedback and adaptive triggers provide a level of realism that enhances my gaming experience, and the built-in speakers allow me to hear in-game sounds directly from the controller, making it even more immersive. The built-in microphone and headset jack make it easy to communicate with friends online, and the mute button is a useful feature for when I need to quickly turn off voice capture. In terms of aesthetics, the midnight black color gives the controller a sleek and professional look. Overall, this controller has greatly improved my gaming experience and I highly recommend it over other color options.

avaliacoes: While most PG gamers that use controllers go for the Xbox controllers, i find their joystick locations to be from weird to terribad. I've always preferred DualShock controllers on my PC, and this Dualsense is definitely better than even the Dualshock 4. Wireless lag is a lot less than the DS4, the controller itself is slightly larger and a tad more comfortable for my large-ish hands, and Steam compatibility is perfect. It is definitely heavier than a  DS4 so it may not be as comfortable for long gaming sessions but i haven't found that many issues yet.

avaliacoes: Received the controller on 10/13/22. As soon as I finished modifying the controller I wired it up to my pc and started playing. Fresh out of the box this controller has zero stick drift! Unlike my Xbox Elite Series 2 which came with stick drift when I purchased it new from Best Buy. In the Modern Warfare 2019 settings I am able to set my left stick deadzone at 0.00 and my right stick deadzone at 0.02. If you‚Äôre looking to get a Scuf alternative for way less then I highly recommend looking into Extreme Rates Rise4 back paddle kit with their micro clicky hair trigger kit as well as their clicky face kit. Before purchasing their kits I strongly recommend opening up your controller to find out which model you have since their kits only work with bdm-010 and bdm-020.

produto: PlayStation DualSense Wireless Controller - Starlight Blue - PlayStation 5
avaliacoes: I love the PS5 controller. I didn‚Äôt think much could beat the DS4, but here we are with adaptive triggers, a wonderful size, and lots of small little features that go unnoticed from ergonomics to finishing on the buttons. This light blue is fantastic and sets nicely with the white of the console, and it seems more‚Ä¶sturdy than my launch controllers. While the price is high, if you need one, buy one. They do work well and so far better than DS4 as a Bluetooth or connected PC controller (no need to run DS4Windows anymore!) though imagine the more hardcore folks will want to tune performance and dead zones there anyway. Still, I dig it, and works both as intended and outside scope.

This wouldn't bother me, but,  PSN actively spies on your personal messages and conversations to FIND THINGS to ban you for. I don't know for sure because PSN banned my account without telling me a reason why, then when I asked why, they bricked my ps4. It's been since September 2022, still no answer, and they dance around the subject when I call in.  If you buy these,  don't use the online features of your Playstation for anything but playing the game, anything else has a high chance of getting you banned for literally nothing.
